0.body:
About
This is a cook book for Yew. It demonstrates various Yew concepts and actions you will typically perfom using Yew. Each chapter's code demonstration is a mini standalone Yew project that you run locally on your machine. Conventions
Pay attention to the comments. //*or// *: Important comments essential to the currently viewed chapter's code demo have this comment. //: Regular comments that are used to annotate what is going on in a given chapter's code demo. Attributions Introduction to Yew.rs: This documentation project took inspiration from, is based on, and modeled after this wonderful course. Yew.rs: This is the Yew Official documentation page. References have been made here to keep in sync with the Yew's developmental pace and stay up to date! This is the ultimate sanctuary to meditate on Yew.
0.title: Introduction

31.body:
Render components based on the url entered on a browser's address bar. New file "yew_project_name::src::router.rs" created New dir "yew_project_name::src::components::routes" created Yew folder structure:: |-yew_project_name |-dist |-src |-components |-mod.rs |-sub_components_a |-sub_components_a_component_1.rs |-form_components |-form_input_component |-form_button_component |-form_assembly_component |-mod.rs |-routes |-mod.rs |-home.rs |-route_one.rs |-route_two.rs |-lib.rs |-main.rs |-router.rs |-main.css |-target |-Cargo.lock |-Cargo.toml |-index.html INSIDE 'Cargo.toml' [package]
name = "yew_project_name"
version = "0.1.0"
edition = "2021" [dependencies] yew = "0.19.3" stylist = {version = "0.10.8" features = ["yew"]} wasm-bindgen = "0.2.79" web-sys = { version = "0.3.56", features = ["HtmlInputElement] } gloo = "0.6.1" yew-router = "0.16.0"
31.title: Yew router - 'BrowserRouter'

32.breadcrumbs: Yew router - 'BrowserRouter' » //* You need to depend on yew-router
32.title: //* You need to depend on yew-router

44.body:
New DIR "yew_project_name/src/stores" created
N.B: You should actually create multiple stores for deeply integral data types to be stored
For a quick look, jump to file "yew_project_name/src/stores/sample_store_one.rs" Yew folder structure:: |-yew_project_name |-dist |-src |-components |-mod.rs |-sample_store_one_user_component.rs |-sample_store_one_button_component.rs |-stores |-mod.rs |-sample_store_one.rs |-lib.rs |-main.rs |-target |-Cargo.lock |-Cargo.toml |-index.html INSIDE 'Cargo.toml' [package]
name = "yew_project_name"
version = "0.1.0"
edition = "2021" [dependencies] yew = "0.19.3" stylist = {version = "0.10.8" features = ["yew"]} wasm-bindgen = "0.2.79" gloo = "0.8.0"

49.body:
New DIR "yew_project_name/src/stores" created
N.B: You should actually create multiple stores for deeply integral data types to be stored
For a quick look, jump to file: - "yew_project_name/src/stores/sample_store.rs" - "yew_project_name/src/components/sample_store_user_component.rs" - "yew_project_name/src/components/sample_store_summary_component.rs" In this demo, a centralized state store will be created to manage a hypothetical form data for function components and you'd see how data can be added, changed, and even requested from the centralized state store. Yew folder structure:: |-yew_project_name |-dist |-src |-components |-mod.rs |-sample_store_user_component.rs |-sample_store_summary_component.rs |-stores |-mod.rs |-sample_store.rs |-lib.rs |-main.rs |-target |-Cargo.lock |-Cargo.toml |-index.html INSIDE 'Cargo.toml' [package]
name = "yew_project_name"
version = "0.1.0"
edition = "2021" [dependencies] yew = "0.19.3" wasm-bindgen = "0.2.79" web-sys = { version="0.3.60", features = ["HtmlInputElement"] }
49.breadcrumbs: Yewdux for persistent storage in functional components » Yewdux for persistent storage in functional components (Form Demo)
49.title: Yewdux for persistent storage in functional components (Form Demo)
